Recipe.title: StuffMeing
Recipe.Source: Based on a Recipe from Karla Therriault

section.instruction: Cut Onion into ¼-inch discs, then slice the discs into 8 wedges.
Cut Celery into thin slices. Slice the leaves into the same thickness.
Chop Sage Leaves until pieces are ⅛-inch squares or smaller.
Remove Thyme Leaves from stems, but don't chop.
If using Mushrooms, cut into ¼-inch slices. (If slices are more than 1½ inch wide, cut in half.)

Using a bread knife, cut Bread slices into 1-inch x 1-inch squares.
(This can be done with several slices at a time.)
In a saucepan, melt the butter then stir in the Onion, Celery, Sage, Thyme, Salt and Pepper. Reduce heat to low, and simmer with lid on, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
Add Mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add Turkey Broth, turn burner to high and bring to a boil.
Turn off burner, add Bread and gently stir until all bread has absorbed Broth.
Let sit for 5 minutes and gently stir again.

Notes.note: The Turkey Broth should be obtained from the turkey's drippings when it is done cooking.

Modifications.modification: If not being prepared as a side dish for turkey, use chicken, vegetable, or some other flavor of broth.
Instead of Fresh Sage and Thyme, dried can be used.
Add 2-4 Oz. fully cooked Sausage, broken into pea-sized chunks, just before adding the bread.
